title: Launch of Dark Mode Feature
transcript:
Clara: Hi everyone, thanks for joining. Today we’re discussing the launch of the dark mode feature on our mobile app.
Malik: Hey, on the dev side, iOS is done and Android is almost ready. There’s just a small bug with the switch animation.
Sophie: For UX, I’ve checked the dark mode designs and it looks good, but we need to adjust contrast on some buttons for accessibility.
Hugo: Got it. I can start testing on iOS once Malik fixes the bug, then Android.
Clara: Perfect. Malik, can you fix it by tomorrow?
Malik: Yes, I can. I’ll prioritize it today.
Clara: Great. Sophie, can you update the designs and share them with QA?
Sophie: Yes, I’ll do that this morning.
Clara: Excellent. Action plan: bug fixed by Malik, QA tests by Hugo, designs shared by Sophie. We’ll meet on Friday for the final review. Thanks!

title: End-of-Year Team-Building Organization
transcript:
Julien: Hello, today we need to plan the end-of-year team-building. We need to decide on location, date, and activities.
Laura: I suggest the week of December 15, that gives everyone enough time to organize.
Pierre: For the location, I have two options: an escape game or a day at an adventure park.
Nina: Will the budget cover the adventure park?
Laura: Yes, with 20 people, it stays within our budget.
Julien: Okay, adventure park it is. What activities exactly?
Pierre: Zipline, ropes course, and a small team-building challenge.
Nina: Perfect, I’ll prepare the booking and the quote.
Laura: I’ll handle informing the teams and managing transportation.
Julien: Great, I’ll put everything in the calendar and send a confirmation email. Thanks everyone!

title: Digital Marketing Campaign Follow-Up
transcript:
Karim: Hi everyone, today we’re reviewing the Facebook ad campaign.
Alice: Early feedback is good, click-through rate is 2.5%, slightly above our target.
Thomas: Confirmed, and most leads are in the 25-34 age range.
Emilie: Great. I’ll adjust the content to better target this audience.
Karim: Excellent. Alice, can you monitor the budget for the next weeks?
Alice: Sure, no problem. We still have 40% of the budget left to boost posts.
Karim: Perfect. We’ll meet next week for the final results. Thanks!

title: Product Backlog Review
transcript:
Marc: Hello everyone, let’s start the backlog review for the next sprint.
Léa: Priorities are clear: improve site search, fix critical bugs, and add an advanced filter option.
Romain: Improved search is doable, but the advanced filter will take a bit more time on the backend.
Camille: I can help with deployment and prepare test environments.
Marc: Great. How long for the advanced filter?
Romain: About 4 days, so we might need to postpone a lower-priority task.
Léa: Okay, we can delay the “custom icon addition” to the next sprint.
Marc: Perfect, I’ll update the backlog and send the summary. Thanks!
